definition: to lean unsteadily from side to side (idiom)/to sway/(of buildings etc) to lean at a crazy angle
east/host (i.e. sitting on east side of guest)/landlord
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish
askew/at a crooked angle/devious/noxious/(coll.) to lie on one's side

sentences.english: The truck careened around the corner.
sentences.chinese: 卡车东倒西歪地驶过街角。

sentences.english: The audience were convulsed with laughter.
sentences.chinese: 他的笑话使听众东倒西歪。

sentences.english: The car jolted us badly over the rough road.
sentences.chinese: 汽车在凸凹不平的路上把我们颠簸得东倒西歪。
这个东倒西歪的粮仓该修理了。

sentences.english: The clump of bamboo outside the window was completely flattened by the raging winds.
sentences.chinese: 窗外的竹子被狂风吹得稀里哗啦，东倒西歪。

sentences.english: Zero zebras zigzagged into the zoo.
sentences.chinese: 零只班马东倒西歪地进入动物园。
这辆旧汽车东倒西歪地行驶。

sentences.english: The car bucketed down the steep road.
sentences.chinese: 汽车在陡峭的路上东倒西歪地前进。

definition: to suffer a crushing defeat (idiom)/in a pitiful state/in a complete mess/to roll (with laughter)
battered and exhausted/stuck in a dilemma
to faint with blurred vision (idiom); dizzy and eyes dimmed
